properties.Name: ChannelProductTargetMarket
properties.Description:
The Channel Market to which Product marketing communications and advertising is directed.

"Target Marketing" is the strategy that identifies groups in a Market and develops products or advertising based upon the characteristics and attributes of that group.    This is just the opposite of "Mass Marketing", which applies a single Product to all market segments.

Target Marketing involves three basic activities:

1.  Segment the Market - based upon geographic, demographic, psychographic or behavioral characteristics.

2.  Target the Market -  by identifying the specific Market Segments that will be addressed.  

3.  Position the Product - to make it most appealing to the target Market Segment consumer.

Upon defining target markets, one of three strategies must be selected for implementation:

1.  Undifferentiated Marketing
2.  Differentiated Marketing
3.  Concentrated Marketing

Columns.Name: ChannelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Channel.

Columns.Name: ProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: MarketId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Market.

Columns.Name: PlannedChannelProductMarketIntroductionDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Product is planned for introduction into the Channel Target Market.

Columns.Name: ActualChannelProductMarketIntroductionDate
Columns.Description: The actual date that the Product was introduced into the Channel Target Market.

Columns.Name: PlannedChannelMarketProductSalesUnitsQuantity
Columns.Description: The planned number of Product units that are to be sold into the Channel Target Market during the defined period.

Columns.Name: ActualChannelMarketProductSalesUnitsQuantity
Columns.Description: The actual number of Product units sold into the Channel Target Market during the period defined.

Columns.Name: PlannedChannelMarketProductSalesRevenueAmount
Columns.Description: The planned gross sales revenue amount to be generated by Product unit sales into the Channel Target Market during the period defined.

Columns.Name: ActualChannelMarketProductSalesRevenueAmount
Columns.Description: The actual gross sales revenue amount generated by Product unit sales into the Channel Target Market during the period defined.

Properties.Description:
The Channel Market to which Product marketing communications and advertising is directed.

"Target Marketing" is the strategy that identifies groups in a Market and develops products or advertising based upon the characteristics and attributes of that group.    This is just the opposite of "Mass Marketing", which applies a single Product to all market segments.

Target Marketing involves three basic activities:

1.  Segment the Market - based upon geographic, demographic, psychographic or behavioral characteristics.

2.  Target the Market -  by identifying the specific Market Segments that will be addressed.  

3.  Position the Product - to make it most appealing to the target Market Segment consumer.

Upon defining target markets, one of three strategies must be selected for implementation:

1.  Undifferentiated Marketing
2.  Differentiated Marketing
3.  Concentrated Marketing
